content: Anyone know? Is it eastern? @Sandra Vance @Mary Ann Boyle
Hopefully, it's US Pacific Standard Time (i.e. UTC -8) as discussed at one of the recent Co-Chair Webinars.
yes, the timezone for the connectathon is the same as the WGM. It will be in PT
cc @Sandra Vance but I believe the times listed in the slides and meetings are usually ET. Each track typically calls out their own schedule, which may take into account multi-timezone participants
If they're not, I have some updates to do to our track schedule :)
https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIR/2021-01+Connectathon+26
eg: from that page and the schedule, the prep meeting is 4pm ET... so I assumed the schedule of events was all ET as well
hi guys - I am working on getting a final answer on this now. The WGM is in PT so we may transition the whole Connectathon.

Sandra Vance said:

hi guys - I am working on getting a final answer on this now. The WGM is in PT so we may transition the whole Connectathon.

This whole virtual thing is making life a big cuckoo, isn't it??
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7uy0ldI_1HA&t=227
It would be really nice if times listed in schedules always included a UTC version.

Michael Lawley said:

It would be really nice if times listed in schedules always included a UTC version.

If only there were international standards for interoperable data that would work anywhere. :-)

Yes - based on the use of ET in Sandy's orientation I assumed it was ET. This might be confusing. I think we might need to get the word out that its Pacific Time. We scheduled ours on Eastern based on Sandy's orientation.
I am more confused. Is it ET or PT? @Sandra Vance @Virginia Lorenzi

Yunwei Wang said:

I am more confused. Is it ET or PT? Sandra Vance Virginia Lorenzi

Yes indeed - the Connectathon's own web page says "Agenda coming soon"! :smile: Help!
I understand each track has its own agenda. The question is for the general sessions
Sandy clarified today - its Pacific.

Yes, thank you Virginia. The Connectathon and WGM will be in PT for January. May will be on GMT/ UTC time, and September will be on ET. Wayne announced this at the co-chair meeting, and it has been in all the emails about the meeting too. It will also be stated again at the track lead training session today (1/5). If you need that link, please let me or Sandy know and we can send it out again. Currently we only have 5 track leads scheduled to attend.

Great info, @Mary Ann Boyle!

FWIW, I registered and have only received one email about it, the order confirmation. What am I missing? Sorry!

(Specifically, I searched in gmail "connectathon from:hl7.org")
@Sandra Vance sent an email to all track leads for the training today and has sent out other emails for other training sessions that she has held.
emails from HQ would come from announcements@HL7.org
here is one that went out at 9am ET today
image.png

Mary Ann Boyle said:

here is one that went out at 9am ET today

Aha! :smile: I got that "registration is still open" email, though I HAVE already registered ... it does link to the agenda, but

  • As someone who HAS registered, I've not been sent that info (irony!)
  • The HL7 FHIR Connectathons page for this event says this for agenda:
    image.png

So maybe they could add the agenda link to that page.

Thanks for demystifying us - much appreciated. (I presume I'm not the only one who hasn't been reached with the info, since others were asking.)

Will there be event info emails going out to us who've registered?
we just got it from Sandy today, so you will see it soon. = ) We are uploading the content now

I think you've misunderstood my request -- I would like to see the times specified relative to UTC so I can easily convert without having to magically know what ET and PT and ??? are relative to UTC. We are an international community, no?

i.e., instead of (or as well as) 9am ET , specify 9am ET (UTC-5)
this will also help out with issues relating to daylight time changes
(deleted)

Yunwei Wang said:

I am more confused. Is it ET or PT? Sandra Vance Virginia Lorenzi

All Connectathon events will be held in Pacific Time during the event.
it is PST
It is PST
AKA UTC-8
